description: Generate embeddings using Amazon Bedrock models.

model_id.info: The Amazon Bedrock embedding model to use.

aws_access_key_id.info: The access key for your AWS account. Usually set in Python code as the environment variable 'AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID'.

aws_secret_access_key.info: The secret key for your AWS account. Usually set in Python code as the environment variable 'AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY'.

aws_session_token.info: The session key for your AWS account. Only needed for temporary credentials. Usually set in Python code as the environment variable 'AWS_SESSION_TOKEN'.

credentials_profile_name.info: The name of the profile to use from your ~/.aws/credentials file. If not provided, the default profile will be used.

region_name.info: The AWS region where your Bedrock resources are located.

endpoint_url.info: The URL of the AWS Bedrock endpoint to use.

success.embeddings_initialized: Amazon Bedrock embeddings model '{model}' initialized successfully in region '{region}'

errors.langchain_aws_not_installed: langchain_aws is not installed. Please install it with `pip install langchain_aws`.
errors.boto3_not_installed: boto3 is not installed. Please install it with `pip install boto3`.

logs.session_created_with_keys: AWS session created with access keys
logs.session_created_default: AWS session created with default credentials
